comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: obviously at a baseball game, I would guess by the larger billboards at the back, early 20th century Roi-tan was a cigar company, as was/is Cuesta-Rey. Cuban cigars. Could this be at Guantanamo Bay? Not saying it was taken here, but if you look along the back wall in this photo, you'll see large painted billboards as well, so it's probably in the 1910's 1920's www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3739604190/

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: It is probably at the old Naval Training Center in San Diego, they still have two baseball fields there. See: www.sandiego.gov/ntc/graphics/ntcparklarge.jpg
